skin_cancer.name: Skin Cancer
skin_cancer.description: Abnormal growth of skin cells, most often developed on skin exposed to the sun. Early detection is crucial for successful treatment.
symptoms: New, unusual growth or sore that doesn't heal
Change in existing mole (size, color, shape)
Spot that looks different from others
Bleeding or oozing from skin lesion
immediate_actions: Schedule appointment with dermatologist within 1-2 weeks
Document lesion with photos for tracking
Avoid further sun exposure to affected area
prevention: Avoid peak sun hours (10 AM - 4 PM)
skin_cancer.treatment_overview: Treatment depends on type, size, and stage. Options include surgical excision, Mohs surgery, radiation, chemotherapy, or immunotherapy.
skin_cancer.prognosis: When detected early, most skin cancers are highly treatable with 5-year survival rates >90% for localized cases.

pimples.name: Acne / Pimples
pimples.description: Common skin condition caused by clogged hair follicles, bacteria, and inflammation. Typically affects face, chest, back, and shoulders.
symptoms: Visible bumps or lesions on skin
immediate_actions: Keep affected area clean with gentle cleanser
Avoid touching or picking at pimples
Consider over-the-counter benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid
prevention: Wash face twice daily with mild cleanser
Don't squeeze or pick at acne
pimples.treatment_overview: Topical treatments (retinoids, benzoyl peroxide, antibiotics), oral medications (antibiotics, hormonal therapy, isotretinoin for severe cases), and procedural treatments (chemical peels, laser therapy).
pimples.prognosis: Most acne improves with treatment. Scarring can occur with severe cases or improper handling. Consult dermatologist for persistent cases.
references: NIH - National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases

normal.name: Normal / Healthy Skin
normal.description: No concerning lesions or abnormalities detected. Skin appears healthy with normal characteristics.
symptoms: No signs of infection or inflammation
maintenance_tips: Follow balanced diet rich in antioxidants
preventive_care: Monitor for any new or changing spots
when_to_see_doctor: Existing mole changes size, color, or shape
Sore that doesn't heal within 3 weeks
references: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

dermatologist.description: Medical doctors specialized in diagnosing and treating skin, hair, and nail conditions
dermatologist.qualifications: MD or DO + 3-4 years dermatology residency
dermatologist.when_to_consult: Any suspicious skin changes, persistent skin conditions, cosmetic concerns

surgical_oncologist.description: Surgeons specialized in cancer diagnosis and surgical treatment
surgical_oncologist.qualifications: MD + General Surgery Residency + Surgical Oncology Fellowship
surgical_oncologist.when_to_consult: Confirmed or suspected cancer diagnosis requiring surgical intervention

radiation_oncologist.description: Physicians specialized in treating cancer with radiation therapy
radiation_oncologist.when_to_consult: Cancer treatment plan includes radiation therapy
